name: google-dorking
label: Google Dorking
description: Google Dorking refers to the practice of using advanced search operators in Google's search engine to discover information that may not be readily accessible through conventional search queries.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.description: Specify the URL of the Google Dorking server to connect and perform automated operations.
fields.name: server_url
fields.tooltip: Specify the URL of the Google Dorking server to connect and perform automated operations.

fields.title: API Key
fields.description: Specify the API key to access the endpoint to connect and perform the automated operations
fields.name: api_key
fields.tooltip: Specify the API key to access the endpoint to connect and perform the automated operations

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified. By default, this option is set to True.
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.tooltip: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified. By default, this option is set to True.

operations.title: Custom Search
operations.description: A custom search refers to the ability to create a personalized search engine tailored to the specific needs of a website's audience, providing a customized and efficient way for users to find content within a website.

parameters.title: Search Engine ID
parameters.description: Specify the Programmable Search Engine you want to use to perform this search. The search engine must be created with the Control Panel Note: The Search Engine ID (cx) can be of different format (e.g. 8ac1ab64606d234f1)
parameters.name: cx
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Programmable Search Engine you want to use to perform this search. The search engine must be created with the Control Panel Note: The Search Engine ID (cx) can be of different format (e.g. 8ac1ab64606d234f1)

parameters.title: Search Query
parameters.description: A search query refers to the text or keywords entered by a user into a search engine when they are looking for information, documents, websites, or any other content.
parameters.name: q
parameters.tooltip: A search query refers to the text or keywords entered by a user into a search engine when they are looking for information, documents, websites, or any other content.. Note: The limit on the length of the search request should be within 2048 characters.

parameters.title: Count
parameters.description: Specify the maximum count of records that you want this operation to fetch from Google Dorking. By default, this option is set to 10, and valid values are integers between 1 and 10.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum count of records that you want this operation to fetch from Google Dorking. By default, this option is set to 10, and valid values are integers between 1 and 10.
parameters.name: num

parameters.title: Start
parameters.description: Specify the index of the first result to return. The default number of results per page is 10, so &start=11 would start at the top of the second page of results. Note: The JSON API will never return more than 100 results, even if more than 100 documents match the query, so setting the sum of start + count to a number greater than 100 will produce an error. Also note that the maximum value for count is 10.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the index of the first result to return. The default number of results per page is 10, so &start=11 would start at the top of the second page of results. Note: The JSON API will never return more than 100 results, even if more than 100 documents match the query, so setting the sum of start + count to a number greater than 100 will produce an error. Also note that the maximum value for count is 10.
parameters.name: start

parameters.title: Additional Fields
parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.tooltip: Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to retrieve details from Google Dorking.
parameters.description: Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to retrieve details from Google Dorking. For reference, you can refer this link https://developers.google.com/custom-search/v1/reference/rest/v1/cse/list#request
